Title: Retail Operations Data Analyst
Description:
Meta is looking for a Reality Labs (RL) Retail Operations Data Analyst. This person will be responsible for planning, budgeting, communicating, building, maintaining, and reporting on all aspects as it relates to Channel Enablement Operations programs across all of our existing and future partners. There will be a retail operations focus that this role will require. This role plays an instrumental part in helping customers find, learn and experience Reality Labs products through physical retail. The primary role of the RL Retail Operations Data Analyst is to work with data and ensure data is managed with accuracy, accessibility and with visualization in mind. The role is impact, accuracy and organization oriented with the goal of defining functional processes. The RL Retail Operations Data Analyst must be have experience in a fast-paced environment, executing multiple projects at a time while working collaboratively and communicating clearly across teams.

Retail Operations Data Analyst Responsibilities:


Build processes for the retail organization based on business needs and requirements presented from the organization.
Manage, maintain and visualize large volumes of data from multiple sources globally using Tableau.
Partner closely with Channel Marketing Managers, Strategic Account Managers, 3rd party labor partners, Analytics and Channel Services team members on a regular basis to run the business with the utmost efficiency and accuracy.
Act as liaison between global 3rd party labor partners, channel marketing managers and channel services for data management.
Assess and make calculated decisions to maximize return on investment and efficiency by leveraging partnerships with the internal analytics team.
Build highly detailed analysis recommendations for a variety of Reality Labs initiatives across all product lines.
Create, maintain, and enforce in-store data collection processes with 3rd party labor partners.
Review instructions and execution for multiple projects simultaneously with a keen eye for detail.
Manage field execution reporting to internal stakeholders via dashboards.
Develop and launch key performance indicator management tools and dashboard by managing engineering resources.


Minimum Qualifications:


5+ years of professional experience designing, building and managing data visualizations
3+ years of retail operations, channel marketing analytics or relevant experience.
Experience with Tableau, PowerBi, Alteryx, Hive and other data visualization and customization tools.
Experience managing data pipelines and ingestion processes
Experience understanding the unique operating conditions within retailers and how that impacts the planning and executing of the initiatives for all product lines.
Experience sharing program/project updates across broad teams and organizations.
Experience Creating/Managing Data Visualization
Extremely high level of accuracy and attention to detail with the experience to track and communicate the intricacies of reporting results for project execution.
Experience managing relationships with cross-functional stakeholders and external vendors.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Economics, Statistics, or Data Science).


Preferred Qualifications:


Tableau Certified Data Analyst preferred
Consumer Electronics experience.
Microsoft and Google Suite expert proficiency
Familiarity with retail partners and their guidelines and processes.
Experience within a brand managing analysis and budgets.
Experience in reporting on large-scale launches and programs.
Experience in working in a highly cross-functional setting.
Experience translating complex engineering and data related items to make them understandable by the lowest common denominator.
Experience with AI enhanced Data Modeling and Analysis
Understanding of SQL subqueries, statements, join types, window functions, common

Title: Data Analyst, Product
Description:
About The Role

As a Product Analyst, you will have the opportunity to develop, test, launch and scale member banking experience products. Through experimentation, user behavioral analysis, sophisticated statistical and data science modeling, and dashboards development, you will surface product insights and recommendations that will increase adoption, engagement, and retention of our members.

In this role, you will work closely with product managers, user research, engineers, product & lifecycle marketing, and operational stakeholders to foster a data-driven product development culture, advise our product roadmaps, and build a deep understanding of member behavior.

The base salary offered for this role and level of experience will begin at $124,600 USD and go up to $155,800 USD. Full-time employees are also eligible for a bonus, competitive equity package, and benefits. The actual base salary offered may be higher, depending on your location, skills, qualifications, and experience.

In this role, you can expect to


Keep a pulse on performance metrics and KPIs. You will be positioned to have a view of the business, product, and member base and encouraged to understand and explain trends.
Foster a data-driven, test-and-learn culture with your passion for telling stories with data - not only surfacing insights but also presenting those insights and recommendations to encourage and inspire change.
Partner widely with product, engineering, research, and design to translate your insights to guide product development. You‚Äôll use data to help the organization understand how members are interacting with Chime and convert that to business and experience implications.
Lead experimentation by providing mentorship on how they should be run, defining success metrics and data requirements, evaluating impact, and providing strategic direction.
Advise roadmap, analysis and metric ideation, and strategic discussions with stakeholders.
Collaborate with analysts and other functions to help bridge business questions and technical (data / computational) solutions.


To thrive in this role, you have


4+ years in data-focused roles (post-internship), building analytical infrastructure and data tools that support a wide audience and facilitate decisions of trade-offs. B2C product analytics and FinTech experience preferred.
Expertise in SQL - you innately translate business questions to queries, understand the edge cases of joins, and can explore a warehouse to find data most appropriate to the problem.
Familiarity in R or python - you write reproducible code and have a tendency toward automation.
Experience leading experimentation, statistical analysis, and sophisticated measurement (e.g. causal inference) E2E to guide decision making.
Hands-on experience with BI/Visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, etc).
Experience building metric frameworks to understand user behaviors.
Ability to think holistically to solve business problems at hand and navigate through ambiguity.
Excellent stakeholder managements skills, with a record of working cross-functionally to achieve results.
A focus on impact - you don‚Äôt stop with just recommendations but ensure to see work through to changing the business.


A Little About Us

At Chime, we believe that everyone can achieve financial progress. We‚Äôre passionate about developing solutions and services to empower people to succeed. Every day, we start with empathy for our members and stay motivated by our desire to support them in ways that make a meaningful difference.

We created Chime‚Äîa financial technology company, not a bank*-- founded on the premise that basic banking services should be helpful, transparent, and fair. Chime helps unlock the access and ability our members need to overcome the systemic barriers that block them from moving forward. By providing members with access to liquidity, rewards, and credit building, our easy-to-use tools and intuitive platforms give members the ability to have more control over their money and to take action toward achieving their financial ambitions.

So far, we‚Äôre well-loved by our members and proud to have helped millions of people unlock financial progress, whether they started a savings account, bought their first car or home, opened a business, or went to college. Every day, we‚Äôre inspired by our members‚Äô dreams and successes, big and small.

We‚Äôre uniting everyday people to unlock their financial progress‚Äîwill you join us?


Chime partners with The Bancorp Bank and Stride Bank, N.A., Members FDIC, that power the bank accounts used by Chime Members.


What We Offer


üè¢ A thoughtful hybrid work policy that combines in-office days and trips to team and company-wide events depending on location to ensure you stay connected to your work and teammates, whether you‚Äôre local to one of our offices or remote
üíª Hybrid work perks, like UrbanSitter and Kinside for backup child, elder and/or pet care, as well as a subsidized commuter benefit
üí∞ Competitive salary based on experience
‚ú® 401k match plus great medical, dental, vision, life, and disability benefits
üèù Generous vacation policy and company-wide Chime Days, bonus company-wide paid days off
ü´Ç 1% of your time off to support local community organizations of your choice
üëü Annual wellness stipend to use towards eligible wellness related expenses
üë∂ Up to 24 weeks of paid parental leave for birthing parents and 12 weeks of paid parental leave for non-birthing parents
üë™ Access to Maven, a family planning tool, with $15k lifetime reimbursement for egg freezing, fertility treatments, adoption, and more.
üéâ In-person and virtual events to connect with your fellow Chimers‚Äîthink cooking classes, guided meditations, music festivals, mixology classes, paint nights, etc., and delicious snack boxes, too!
üíö A challenging and fulfilling opportunity to join one of the most experienced teams in FinTech and help millions unlock financial progress

We believe this gives us a competitive advantage to better serve our members and helps us all grow as Chimers and individuals.

Description:
Curology provides incredibly personalized, effective, and affordable dermatology care at scale. We are a top player in custom skincare - we've helped millions of people feel more confident in their skin, offering custom acne or anti-aging prescription skincare delivered right to your door!

We're looking for a Data Analyst focused on Lifecycle Marketing to partner closely with our lifecycle team. Guide experimentation efforts across retention marketing by helping design A/B tests, tracking key metrics, and conducting rigorous post-test analysis. Translate results into data-backed decisions.
Develop and maintain statistical models and segmentation frameworks to support personalization, targeting, and lifecycle automation strategies.
Collaborate with data engineering and product partners to ensure accurate, scalable access to marketing data and assist in identifying data gaps, inconsistencies, or instrumentation needs.
Continuously seek optimization opportunities by surfacing growth levers or friction points, and championing data-driven ideas that improve retention, reduce churn, and maximize customer value.
Enable ongoing learning and communication through self-serve data tools, proactive reporting, and recurring insight share-outs to CRM, growth, and leadership stakeholders.
Identify opportunities to improve campaign performance and inform experimentation roadmaps for email, push, in-app, and SMS channels.
Address root causes of performance shifts and data variances using various analytical techniques and investigative approaches



Requirements


5-7 years of experience in data analytics, preferably with a focus on CRM, retention, or lifecycle marketing
Strong SQL skills and experience with Python, Tableau, or Hex for data analysis and visualization
Deep understanding of customer segmentation, funnel analysis, and LTV modeling
Experience in A/B testing: designing experiments, analyzing results, and translating findings into strategy
Prior work in growth or product analytics, especially with retention, reactivation, and churn prevention initiatives
Subscription experience preferred
Familiarity with ETL frameworks, working closely with data engineers to define logging needs and address data quality issues
Proven ability to clearly communicate insights across technical and non-technical audiences, with strong storytelling and presentation skills
A proactive, collaborative, and curious mindset with a drive to continuously improve business outcomes through data

Competitive salary and equity packages
Comprehensive benefits: medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees; flexible spending account; 401k; mental health & wellness programs
Minimum Time Off policy (unlimited PTO, with at least 3 weeks off) for exempt employees
11 company observed holidays

pre-tax commuter benefits

Company-sponsored events

Overview

JOB DESCRIPTION

We are seeking a Data Analyst II to join our growing Data organization and help set up our Risk & Governance Analytics team. The role reports into the Financial Analytics Senior Manager and will focus on creating insight to drive the growth of the business, partnering closely with the Accounting, Tax, and Finance functions.

Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders in Finance, Tax & Data.

Become a key voice in driving performance in a number of business areas (Product, Acquisition, Marketing, & CRM) across both Sportsbook & Casino.
Collaboration with other Analysts and Data Scientists to find solutions to business problems.
Gather and present insights metrics and activities to key stakeholders, becoming a trusted source of intelligence over time.
Remain current on technology and trends in data analytics and the sports betting & gaming world.
Must be open to occasional travel to Fanatics Betting & Gaming offices and other locations for conferences, events, meetings, and team building activities.

Strong analytical skills, with ability to extract data and transform it into both ad-hoc and structured continuous insights.
Demonstrated ability to partner closely with stakeholders, earning trust and prioritizing relationships.
Experienced with building dashboards and reporting tools (e.g. Tableau, Microstrategy, Power BI, Looker).
Customer obsessed and experience focused; highly outcome-oriented and data-driven; experienced in working in high-growth environments.
Strong skills in SQL and Tableau.
Excellent at influencing and problem solving.
Positive and flexible attitude, a willingness to embrace new initiatives.

Experience with SOX and internal controls are a plus.


If you possess some of these skills but not all of them, we still encourage you to apply!

Alternatively, we are open to a hybrid role based in Denver, CO.

For information about our benefits, please visit https://benefitsatfanatics.com/

About Us

Fanatics is building a leading global digital sports platform. We ignite the passions of global sports fans and maximize the presence and reach for our hundreds of sports partners globally by offering products and services across Fanatics Commerce, Fanatics Collectibles, and Fanatics Betting & Gaming, allowing sports fans to Buy, Collect, and Bet. Through the Fanatics platform, sports fans can buy licensed fan gear, jerseys, lifestyle and streetwear products, headwear, and hardgoods; collect physical and digital trading cards, sports memorabilia, and other digital assets; and bet as the company builds its Sportsbook and iGaming platform. Our more than 22,000 employees are committed to relentlessly enhancing the fan experience and delighting sports fans globally.

Launched in 2021, Fanatics Betting and Gaming is the online and retail sports betting subsidiary of Fanatics, a global digital sports platform. Fanatics Betting and Gaming operates twenty-two retail sports betting locations, including the only sportsbook inside an NFL stadium at Northwest Stadium. Fanatics Betting and Gaming is headquartered in New York with offices in Denver, Leeds and Dublin.

Title: Data Analyst (Go-to-Market)
Description:
Why Great Gray?

At Great Gray Group, we strive to set the bar for the retirement services industry. Our goal is to deliver advanced retirement solutions that combine our core fiduciary services with robust investment options, innovative technology, and dedicated client service. We focus on making choices clearer, transitions smoother, and the client experience more delightful. Complacency isn't in our vocabulary. Every day, we look for opportunities to better serve our clients, be an excellent business partner, and earn the trust of those who rely on us.

The Role

Great Gray is looking to add a GTM Data Analyst on our Revenue Operations team. The GTM Data Analyst drives the strategic analysis of product profitability, sales commission oversight, investor behavior, and market trends. This role is critical for providing deep insights that guide investment decisions and product development, supporting our mission to deliver outstanding value to our investors. The GTM Data Analyst will also support process improvement and engage in revenue operations transformation initiatives.

Location

This position will work from our Boston, MA office. Great Gray currently supports a hybrid work model with 4 days onsite, and 1 day remote.

Visa sponsorship or transfer of an existing visa is not available for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship or transfer.

Responsibilities


Lead the development and implementation of analytics strategies for assessing fund profitability, market dynamics, and investor trends
Oversee the creation of analytical models and tools to evaluate investment opportunities and risks
Collaborate with portfolio managers and the executive team to provide actionable insights for strategic decision-making
Present complex analytical findings in a clear and compelling manner to stakeholders at all levels
Drive the innovation and adoption of advanced analytics and data science techniques within the organization
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data sources and analytical outputs
Stay abreast of industry trends and developments in fund analytics, incorporating best practices into the organization's strategies
Develop and monitor key performance indicators to measure and report on fund performance and investor behavior
Lead special projects and analyses to support organizational goals and initiatives
Support new product initiatives through cost estimation and profitability analysis in order to optimize financial performance of products
Complete other related duties as assigned




Qualifications & Experience


Bachelor's degree plus 3+ years of directly relevant, professional experience
Strong quantitative skills, with proficiency in statistical analysis, financial modeling, and data visualization tools
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to non-technical audiences
Proven track record of leveraging data analytics to inform strategic decision-making
Analytical--Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data; Designs workflows and procedures
Leadership--Exhibits confidence in self and others; Inspires and motivates others to perform well; Effectively influences actions and opinions of others; Accepts feedback from others; Gives appropriate recognition to others
Business Acumen--Understands business implications of decisions; Displays orientation to profitability; Demonstrates knowledge of market and competition; Aligns work with strategic goals
Organizational Support--Follows policies and procedures; Completes administrative tasks correctly and on time; Supports organization's goals and values; Benefits organization through outside activities; Supports affirmative action and respects diversity
Quality--Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Applies feedback to improve performance; Monitors own work to ensure quality
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively
Comfortable navigating ambiguity
Your standards reflect our core values: Growth Mindset, Disciplined Curiosity, Grit, Results Ownership, Collaboration




Benefits
We have a comprehensive and competitive benefits package at Great Gray. Some of the highlights are:



Be an integral part of an early-stage, high-growth organization!
Hybrid work environment
Competitive compensation package including 401(k) with elective and non-elective match opportunities
Lifestyle spending allowance program
Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
Employer-paid life and disability insurance
Generous paid time off program




Company Background
Great Gray is the leading independent provider of trustee and administrative services to Collective Investment Trusts (‚ÄúCITs‚Äù), with over $200 billion in CIT assets under management, across more than 780 funds. We proudly work with 80 subadvisors, including leading firms such as AllianceBernstein, American Funds, BlackRock, Franklin Templeton, MetLife, Neuberger Berman, PGIM, PIMCO and Raymond James.

CITs are more than just an investment vehicle. They represent a forward-thinking approach to retirement planning. These tax-exempt, pooled investment vehicles are offered to employer-sponsored retirement plans, like 401(k)s. CITs are comparable to mutual funds, but, because they are tailored for the institutional retirement market, they can offer distinct advantages, including efficient administration and cost-effectiveness. CITs have a history dating back over 90 years; but they have gained favor over the past decade, driven by innovations, and Great Gray has been at the forefront.

Great Gray has consistently delivered year-over-year growth at an above market rate and is investing in the continued development of its core CIT business as well as complementary administrative services and technology solutions for the retirement market.

Madison Dearborn Partners (‚ÄúMDP‚Äù) purchased Great Gray from Wilmington Trust in April 2023. As a result, Great Gray is an independent company owned by funds affiliated with MDP.

Investor Background

MDP is a leading private equity investment firm based in Chicago. Since MDP's formation in 1992, the firm has raised aggregate capital of over $28 billion and has completed over 150 platform investments. MDP invests across five dedicated industry verticals, including basic industries; business and government software and services; financial and transaction services; health care; and telecom, media, and technology services.

Great Gray, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status or other non-merit factor.
